key_facts: Arav Srinivas â€” former OpenAI researcher and current xAI team member â€” shared a high-quality, Sora-style text-to-video generation demo
The demo sparked viral attention on X, with Elon Musk publicly requesting the prompt, signaling internal xAI progress in generative video
No official product name, release date, or technical details were disclosed, but the output quality suggests advanced diffusion-based spatiotemporal modeling
analyst_angle: This signals xAIâ€™s accelerated push into multimodal foundation modelsâ€”potentially narrowing the generative video gap between OpenAI, Google, and xAI ahead of anticipated Grok-3 or xAI video product launch.

sources.text: Google Gemini can book an Uber or order food for you on Pixel 10 and Galaxy S26. Google's Gemini AI is getting one step closer to being more like an actual assistant. Starting with some Pixel 10 phone

key_facts: Gemini now supports multi-step task automation on Android (e.g., booking rides, ordering food/delivery)
Launched at Samsung Unpacked alongside Galaxy S26; also rolling out to Pixel 10 and Pixel 10 Pro
Features include Gemini automations, enhanced Circle to Search, and real-time scam detection
analyst_angle: This marks Googleâ€™s first production-grade, cross-device AI agent capabilityâ€”moving beyond chat to actionable, context-aware automationâ€”and directly challenges Appleâ€™s Siri roadmap, signaling a shift toward OS-integrated agentic AI as the new competitive frontier.

key_facts: A 15-minute high-intensity AI-generated film was produced by Yonathan and 'The Dor Brothers' in under one week
The project demonstrates exceptional consistency, narrative quality, and end-to-end AI video production capability
Behind-the-scenes (BTS) footage is being prepared to reveal the workflow and tooling used
analyst_angle: This signals accelerating viability of AI-native filmmaking teams â€” moving beyond clips to coherent, story-driven long-form content with near-professional polish and unprecedented speed.

title: ğŸš€ Hermes: Persistent AI Agent That Learns & Accumulates Skills Across Sessions

sources.author: LiorOnAI
sources.text:
Most AI agents are amnesiacs. They solve a problem brilliantly, then forget everything the moment you close the terminal. 

Hermes flips this: it's an agent that writes down what it learns and gets be

sources.author: swyx
sources.text: @joedevon @craigsdennis @karpathy ah. thats a mental note that didnt make it into todays piece. basic idea is gregâ€™s agents directive is basically the same as the bezos api directive. just less brutal

key_facts: Hermes is a locally hosted, persistent AI agent that retains memory, documents learned solutions as reusable skills, and improves over time.
It runs on a dedicated machine (not sandboxed cloud), enabling filesystem access, unattended scheduled tasks, cross-platform state persistence, and spawning of isolated subagents.

Unlike stateless browser-based assistants, Hermes builds procedural memory â€” remembering *how* to do things, not just facts â€” and adapts to user-specific contexts (e.g., codebase, formatting preferences, workflows).

The architecture enables multi-hour autonomous workflows, long-loop automation, and compound value accumulation â€” positioning it as a foundational shift from disposable chatbots to enduring AI teammates.
analyst_angle: Hermes signals a critical inflection toward 'embodied' local agents with persistent state and self-documenting capability â€” challenging the dominant SaaS/chatbot paradigm and accelerating the shift from AI-as-interface to AI-as-infrastructure.

title: ğŸš€ Google DeepMind & Databricks Launch Genie Research Agent

sources.author: GoogleDeepMind
sources.text:
How does a single prompt become a navigable environment? ğŸŒ

We asked the researchers behind Project Genie to explain the mechanics of world models and their potential for training future AI agents. ğŸ§µ

sources.author: databricks
sources.text:
What if you could surface new insights from your enterprise data by just asking questions?

Genie Research Agent is built for forward-looking questions. Hereâ€™s how it works:
- Ask a question like â€œHow

key_facts: Genie Research Agent is a new AI agent designed to autonomously conduct data-driven research on enterprise datasets
It accepts forward-looking natural language questions, generates and iterates on hypotheses, executes analysis, and delivers results in natural language, tables, visuals, and exportable PDF
Developed collaboratively by Google DeepMind (world models / environment generation) and Databricks (enterprise data integration and execution)
analyst_angle: This marks a significant step toward production-grade agentic AI â€” bridging foundational world modeling with real-world enterprise data stacks, lowering the barrier for autonomous business intelligence.

key_facts: Codex 5.3 achieves 5.3 TOPS on agentic coding benchmarks, outperforming Opus 4.6 in agentic-specific evaluation
Its 'xHigh' variant offers exceptional speed but at significantly higher cost
Global average score (e.g., non-agentic or broad-skill benchmarks) still lags behind Opus 4.6, indicating specialization rather than general superiority
analyst_angle: This signals a strategic pivot toward *agentic coding* as a distinct capability axisâ€”where latency, tool-use orchestration, and iterative reasoning matter more than static QA or reasoning scoresâ€”potentially reshaping how dev tools and IDE-integrated AI are benchmarked and deployed.

key_facts: NVIDIA reported $68 billion in Q1 FY2025 revenue (73% YoY growth) and $40 billion in net income
Q1 revenue guidance raised to $78 billion â€” excluding China â€” vs. $72.7B consensus
Networking revenue surged 263% YoY, signaling massive data center infrastructure demand
Total supply-related commitments reached $95.2 billion; inventory up to $21.4B amid strategic wafer and memory allocation lock-up
analyst_angle: This earnings report confirms NVIDIAâ€™s dominance in the AI infrastructure supercycle â€” not just as a chip vendor but as a supply-chain orchestrator, effectively pricing out competitors through vertical control of memory and foundry capacity.

title: ğŸš€ Profound Launches AI Agent Platform for Brand Discovery & Autonomous Transactions

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
â€œEvery marketer on the planet is going to care about how AI talks about their brand.â€

Discovery, as we know it, is beginning to shift.

This week on The Investment Memo, @tryprofound Co-Founder & CEO

sources.author: lightspeedvp
sources.text:
Profound CEO James Cadwalader on why AI changes everything about how we discover products online:

"If I ask ChatGPT for an insurance quote, the next obvious step is: cool, can you go and buy the insu

key_facts: Profound, co-founded by James Cadwallader and Dylan Babbs, has launched a platform enabling AI agents to discover, navigate, and transact on behalf of users â€” redefining brand visibility in the AI-native search era
The company positions itself as an 'analytics wedge' for Fortune 500 brands, helping them optimize for AI-driven discovery (e.g., ChatGPT, Perplexity, Claude) rather than traditional SEO

Core thesis: AI agents are shifting from information retrieval to autonomous action â€” e.g., 'ask for an insurance quote' â†’ 'buy the insurance' â€” making agent-readiness a new competitive imperative for all companies
analyst_angle: This signals the operationalization of 'AI-native marketing': brands must now architect their digital infrastructure (APIs, structured data, agent-friendly interfaces) not just for humans or crawlers, but for autonomous agents that execute end-to-end commercial workflows.

title: ğŸš€ Coding Agents Have Crossed the Threshold: Programming Workflow Fundamentally Disrupted Since December

sources.author: karpathy
sources.text: It is hard to communicate how much programming has changed due to AI in the last 2 months: not gradually and over time in the "progress as usual" way, but specifically this last December. There are a

sources.author: elonmusk
sources.text: Theyâ€™re being taught to hate America

sources.author: elonmusk
sources.text: Iâ€™m sure thatâ€™s about to happen any day now ğŸ¤£

sources.author: elonmusk
sources.text: @wholemars Karma is real

sources.author: elonmusk
sources.text: Tunnels are so underrated

key_facts: Andrej Karpathy observes a sharp, discontinuous improvement in coding agent capability â€” specifically since December â€” with dramatic gains in long-term coherence, tenacity, and ability to autonomously execute multi-step, end-to-end engineering tasks

He demonstrates real-world evidence: an AI agent fully deployed a local video analysis stack (SSH setup, vLLM + Qwen3-VL inference server, web UI, systemd service, documentation) in ~30 minutes without human intervention

Karpathy argues the era of typing code line-by-line is ending; programming is shifting to orchestrating AI agents via natural language, requiring new skills in task decomposition, abstraction layering, and agentic engineering
analyst_angle: This isnâ€™t incremental automation â€” itâ€™s a workflow singularity for software development; the inflection point where AI agents transition from helpers to autonomous executors reshapes hiring, tooling, education, and product velocity across the entire tech stack.
